campaign.story:
The Kickstarter is over, but you can still...
Click to head to the shop!
Meet the small box that prints big adventures.
Saint Paul Maker Fair

WHAT IS IT?
The Choosatron is a fun kit that easily assembles into a small interactive fiction game box, great for social reading and playing. As you play, you make decisions that affect the outcome of the story, and your journey is printed on a keepsake paper scroll. You'll be able to write your own stories as well, using open and free software. Download new stories over Wi-Fi, and share your own stories with other over the internet. Save your unique stories right on the provided SD card. Inspiring for kids, exciting for adults!
I’ve recruited brilliant writers (listed below) to ensure you and your friends will have dozens of stories to play the moment you get your Choosatron. Bill Corbett and Kevin Murphy (both of RiffTrax and MST3K fame) are just two of the amazing writers creating stories just for the Choosatron!
Using the Spark Core Wi-Fi development kit, a thermal printer, and some serious brain wrinkling, I’ve created a platform accessible for everyone to make, play, write, and learn with! It’s Arduino-compatible and totally hackable so as you learn more, the possibilities grow with your imagination.
For more details about each stretch goal, click the images, OR scroll to the very bottom of the page above Risks and Challenges.
Click for stretch goal details!
What's next?
Click for stretch goal details!
...details on 9th Level Games KAMB! apps here!
Click for stretch goal details!
...plus a bonus FREE download of The Siege of the Necromancer (PC/Mac), the very gamebook Tin Man games is writing a Choosatron prequel story for!
Click for stretch goal details!
STRETCH SUMMARY:
A COMPLETE redesign of all writing and Choosatron software! Cross-platform, web based, manage your Choosatron stories, easy to write them, and even easier to share!
A CUSTOM game developed to run on the Choosatron hardware, with 9th Level Games!
TWO professionally designed Choosatron housings to be done by Tim Bachman! Have them made yourself, or order your own!. These will look GOOD.
Another free gamebook adventure download from Tin Man Games for all reward levels!
An official Choosatron T-Shirt design will be made! Sneak a peak a the design in the details.
Click for stretch goal details!
...plus a bonus story by WayForward Game Studio (who just released DuckTales: Remastered, how cool is that?)
Click for stretch goal details!
WHAT MAKES THE CHOOSATRON SO AWESOME?
READING and PLAYING
Playing choice-based stories with friends! Competing for the best ending, worst death, or strangest turn of events!
The Choosatron facilitates "interactive reading", which helps to keep kids (and adults) engaged.
Discover a new way to read. The quick-play stories in the Choosatron invite social reading.
Its portability makes the Choosatron a perfect ice-breaker for social gatherings, caffeinated coffee shops, or alcohol-fueled bar trips!
For the young (at heart): Have you ever read a story twice and had it change? It’s crazy fun!
Get to a gruesome ending? Use the finger-in-page “Continue” feature to jump back through your choices.
It’s tactile; don’t you miss technology with physicality? Like a Polaroid camera with its satisfying click and whir before spitting out a frozen moment of your life! Keep snapshots of your adventures to share as the Choosatron prints each story told on an inkless thermal printer.
WRITING and DESIGNING
Write and share your own Choosatron stories with your friends!
The Choosatron encourages writing arcade-like experiences.
Explore topics from meaningful, to frightful! A hilarious story exploring divorce, or sad story involving jetpacks! Wait...
Features beyond what a paper book can provide, such as a dynamic point system, variables, ending quality, continues, and more!
Currently using Twine, we will creating a new web based writing platform that uses Wi-Fi for easily sending stories to your Choosatron, and sharing with others in the cloud!
Twine: Open source writing software
EDUCATION and LEARNING
Great for STEM (and STEAM)  learning! I’d love to help develop curriculum, get in touch!
Our imaginations are more powerful than the best looking video game or computer-generated blockbuster with giant robots. (Ask a kid to make up a story about giant robots and see what I mean.)
Teach through interactive historical adventures, such as exploring the city of Pompeii before its catastrophic end!
Create interactive multiple choice quizzes that provide instant positive or negative feedback!
Improve literacy or foreign language comprehension using professionally designed Choosatron stories.
Inspire students to create interactive worlds, alone and with their peers.
Home of the Loft Literary Center
MAKING and INVENTING
Powered by a Spark Core (STM32 32-bit ARM Cortex M3 microcontroller paired with a Texas Instruments CC3000 Wi-Fi module)
Inkless thermal printer for output, on-board memory for holding stories, and a keypad for input.
Program over wireless or use the microUSB port.
OPEN SOURCE: everyone will have access to the software and hardware design files, building upon the platform I created and taking the Choosatron to new heights!
Assemble a fully functional Choosatron with a screwdriver in less than 10 minutes.
An RGB LED and piezo speaker included for expanding user feedback, or just adding style to your Choosatron.
A Spark Core you can pull out and prototype your own creations with!
First Choosatron Circuit Board Prototype
The Choosatron began as an homage to the beloved Choose Your Own Adventure® stories of my childhood and my love of arcades. What resulted is a social reading game. When I showed it to friends, their eyes would light up. I was amazed how much it brought out the inner child of whoever played it. To my surprise and delight, after its first public appearance, I was asked to teach a class, featuring The Choosatron, at the Loft.
Created for kids of all ages, the Choosatron has already inspired some amazing social connections, and hilarious stories! I want the Choosatron to get a wider audience, so everyone can enjoy the hands on experience and the joy of writing and sharing their own tale.
EASY TO ASSEMBLE, EASIER TO PLAY!
Prototype Kit
We are simplifying our case design from the above so it will snap together, with just a few screws to keep it secure.
No wiring or soldering needed! Adults AND kids will be able to assemble it in less than 10 minutes. The keypad and printer cables plug neatly in, and the Spark Core will press right into the board.
STORIES TO PLAY
Choosatron stories? You bet! Check out this list of authors:
Alden Bell, Alex Barrett, Andy Rocco Kraft, Andy Sturdevant, Anna Anthropy, Aric McKeown, Bill Corbett, Blake Hoena, Brandi Wells, Brian Oliu, Choose Your Own Adventure®, Eben Burgoon, Forest Lewis, Jack Bowman, James Mitchell, Katie Sisneros, Kevin Murphy, Lloyd Dalton, Maggie Ryan Sandford, Mark Stenberg, Matt Youngmark, Megan Dowd, Pat Harrigan, Patrick Nathan, Reinhardt Suarez, Rob Callahan, Robert Valentine, Russell Rathbun, Scott Mitchell, Seth Heiserman, Shannon Jones, Sharon Stiteler, Tim Uren, Tin Man Games, Tom Reed, V.S. Chin, WayForward Game Studio, Wendy Despain, Wes Burdine...and MORE!
The Wi-Fi connection means it will be possible to share and download additional stories without purchase of additional hardware.
All stories will be compiled into a single super Choosatron book, available as a reward. The print book may not be available for sale after the Kickstarter so don’t miss out on your chance to be a part of something wonderful!
POWERED BY SPARK
In May 2013, the team at Spark Devices launched the Spark Core, an Arduino-compatible Wi-Fi development kit, on Kickstarter. I met the Spark team at their homecoming party here in Minneapolis, and there was major enthusiasm from both sides about the Choosatron and Spark Core. It was a perfect fit! After working with their team, I’m proud to announce that the Choosatron will now be built on the Spark platform, including a Spark Core as part of the kit - a $39 value!
By adding Wi-Fi and Spark we've expanded the possibilities:
group vote choices via mobile devices at an event
capture and visualize how people play your stories
swap out the stories for different occasions - you don't need wireless to play!
over-the-shoulder mode to say live play on your mobile
manage multiple Choosatrons, and so much more!
WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?
The Choosatron isn’t just an idea. It is here. After three prototypes over the last year, the first kit has been developed to be affordable, easy to assemble, and friendly to modifying both hardware and software.
Money will go toward:
Getting the Choosatron into everyone’s hands!
Recouping the development costs from prior to this Kickstarter. I've been funding the Choosatron development myself because I believe in the impact the project can have.
Paying authors for their talent and time.
Design 2 of the Choosatron board: smaller, smarter, and more cost effective!
Design 2 of the Choosatron enclosure: more fun, approachable, functional, and more attention to design!
Build the new Choosatron software platform on the Spark Cloud so writing and sharing stories is as simple as possible.
Preparing hardware and software files for open sourcing, including documentation to make it as accessible as possible.
New features and enhancements to the Choosatron firmware, so authors have more options for how they design their stories.

REWARD DETAILS
Any additions to the rewards will be outlined here since rewards can’t be edited. I’ll also give more details about some of the rewards to make sure they are clear.
REWARD ADD-ONs
Paper Refills: Refills are 5 rolls for $20, and 9 for $30 and are BPA free. You can order as many paper refills, appropriate to your reward level, as you like. Just keep multiplying the cost of the refill, and add that to your funding total. Rolls are 2 1/4" wide and 85 feet long.
International Paper Refills: Any paper roll order starts with a base of $4. For each roll, add another $5. These are also 85 feet and BPA free. If you are planning on ordering a larger quantity, message me and I may be able to price better. Just add this amount to your pledge and we'll figure it out in the survey after the Kickstarter.
(quantity x $5) + $4 = total
Order 1 roll: (1 x $5) + $4 = $9 (not a great deal)
Order 5 rolls: (5 x $5) + $4 = $29 (that isn't too bad!)
Print Choosatron Book: Add only $29 to any reward that includes a CHOOSATRON KIT to get the print book as well. That’s $10 off the book only reward! Add $34 to get the print book SIGNED. (shipped separately, add $20 to ship outside the US)
Shipping: Don’t forget to add shipping if you are not in the US! Costs are listed at the bottom of each reward description, and in the details above.
Have an idea or opportunity you’d like to discuss?
Email me! I think the Choosatron has a lot of great opportunities, and I’d love to discuss any you might have in mind. For my sake, please send as many details as possible. Thanks!

WHO IS JERRY BELICH?
I’m a software developer of over ten years, currently the senior mobile developer at Clockwork in Minneapolis, MN. I love game design, storytelling, play a mean theremin, stay involved in local theatre as an actor, director, and comedian, and dabble in sweding movies.
I’ve had an eclectic career using technology as my creative tool:
I was one of only three developers who created environmental software that runs/syncs 384 screens inside one of the largest/newest casinos in Las Vegas.
I worked for Ray Bradbury as the director of digital effects for the first stage production of Fahrenheit 451 (one of the most HOLY CRAP THIS IS AWESOME times of my life)
I integrated video and stage at the Ordway’s Rocky Horror Picture Show  in St. Paul, MN

Over the last year, while developing the Choosatron, I’ve also been consulting as a professional engineer and storyteller for public spaces, such as exhibits at the Minnesota History Center. I taught a class at the Loft Literary Center in Minneapolis in August 2013, about interactive fiction and creative writing, where each student built their own Choosatron. Contact me to learn about education related opportunities!
I want to use what I’ve learned through years of research and experience to create a platform that takes storytelling everywhere we go. The Choosatron is my first big step towards bringing invention and storytelling hand-in-hand to a new generation.

WHEN WILL I GET MY CHOOSATRON?
Most rewards are currently promised for quarter one of next year. I am working with vetted sources for both manufacturing and distribution to ensure that kits can be produced on a large scale and in a timely manner. Now that the Choosatron is powered by Spark Core, I also have the support of their brilliant team, and can benefit from their first hand work in China. As soon as final designs are sent (within a few weeks of this ending), I will be able to update all of you on how many units will ship by what dates.
In a nutshell:
During Kickstarter: Estimates for the Spark Powered iteration of the Choosatron will be received, prototypes ordered.
August 30th: Kickstarter ends.
- Story editing begins.
- Hardware enhancements (if any from stretch goals) begin.
September 13th: Kickstarter releases the funding to me.
- Complete designs and develop test plan.
October 1st: Choosatron author story drafts due.
October 15th: Final stories will be due, book prep in full swing.
Development of kits underway by now, updates flowing forth!
Legal notice: Choose Your Own Adventure® is a registered trademark of Chooseco LLC.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Choosatron hardware and software have been functional since last summer, and even survived a five week trip to the UK. I’ve had feedback from hundreds of people to help make this kit as fun, versatile, and affordable as possible, while still leaving room to fund further development. I’ve worked in tech professionally for over ten years, have run my own business for over eight, and have had the support of at least half a dozen Kickstarter veterans (including the wonderful people at Spark Devices, go get one!) and frankly, I’m known for completing epic and difficult projects because I LOVE IT. I’m no stranger to managing teams and intense deadlines.

Although it’s my first foray into manufacturing, the companies involved are all proven in both reputation and quality, both through fellow Kickstarters and elsewhere. I have been fastidious about reducing cost and waste, and developing a distribution relationship so you aren’t stuck waiting for me to pack and ship boxes.

The concept for the Choosatron has been proven both functionally and with many happy audiences, as well as engaging kids in an exciting way. I have gone through four functioning prototypes, one being the first iteration of the kit for this Kickstarter, with the second on its way, and its time for this little bird to fly!

The minimum funding will be enough to improve and refine the existing designs and create a better user experience, especially for the younger audience. Base funding will focus on quality, rather than adding lots of extra features and letting scope creep cripple progress. As soon as that goal is met, we can all start getting creative about what happens next!

As for the book, the risk is handling a bunch of writers that may or may not hit their deadlines! They have all been provided a lot of content and guidance to get the ball rolling, and have their deadlines for providing me drafts, and final version. It’s possible some authors disappear, but others will surely end up taking their place. I also have friends that have self-published many times, and a GREAT editor, so I feel pretty good about it!

I will keep everyone informed with regular updates, good, bad, or boring via Facebook, Twitter, my website, and Kickstarter. Maybe even AM radio!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

3. Bad Cases

Hello everyone! Important stuff, so please read.
Ok! The first batch of Choosatrons shipped last Friday, with the rest following not far behind (maybe already have), so it's happening folks! I will admit, I'm not QUITE ready as far as the setup software goes. Progress is great, but the personal delays over November / December took their toll (numerous sicknesses of myself / fiance, and lots of family stuff obviously).

A quick update before we usher in 2015.
First, the latest update is shipping will start January 8th, and manufacturing is going fine!
Second, the writing / setup software is progressing, though still behind where I'd like it to be. Worst case scenario I'll make sure everything is ready to setup / claim your device, and push some of the existing stories onto your Choosatron to play. The Good News

Hi all. I wanted to post a final update on my red flashing issue. With the help of a spark team member, harrisonhjones, I was able to make sure I had all the programs correctly installed on a PC. I wasn't able to get things going on a Mac due to some root error. The green LED was dead/burnt out which was why it was flashing red in DFU mode. Although the core was being recognized on the PC, it was unable to connect to wi-fi due to a hardware issue. I got a new core and was careful to not accidentally static shock it and was able to set up everything with ease. All colors and modes were working perfectly. The only thing that took awhile was downloading the firmware for the choosatron stories because I had saved them to the wrong folder. All is good now and I'm having a lot of fun and the stories are great. Thanks to everyone for their time and suggestions :)

@Rodney: Yes. I used the USB method to connect the core to my PC, and then used BeagleTerm for Chrome (9600 8-N-1) to serial connect to the core and add the credentials to my wireless network and retrieve the ID to claim it. I suggest doing everything in one shot, just get the ID first by pressing "i", then hit "w" and enter your wifi credentials. Once you finish adding them, the core will drop out of USB mode and jump onto your wireless. If you don't claim the core, you won't be able to talk to it wirelessly. Claim the core on the spark.io site by pasting in the ID. Full instructions are on the spark website.

campaign.story:
Over the last year we have captured interviews with over 30 new media artists, curators, designers, and critics, using a new 3D cinema format called RGBD. CLOUDS presents a generative portrait of this digital arts community in a videogame-like environment. The artists inhabit a shared space with their code-based creations, allowing you to follow your curiosity through a network of stories.
What does it feel like to think with code? How can emerging technologies enable us to actualize our dreams? How has online sharing transformed the way artists collaborate?
A preview of the CLOUDS film, science fiction author Bruce Sterling speaks aloud about the art of code.
THE STORY
The creative practitioners featured in the documentary represent a new breed of interdisciplinary artists who combine software engineering, audiovisual design, and cultural engagement. CLOUDS explores the themes of creativity, aesthetics, simulation, and sharing articulated by these luminaries in the computational arts community.
Counter to the widespread perception of code as exclusively utilitarian, this generation of hacker-artists struggles to develop new forms of visual expression, expanding the vocabulary of technology to resonate at a deeper human level. In an increasingly data-driven culture, our subjects act as intermediaries who can help us to navigate and make sense of our evolving digital universe.
Storytellers featured in CLOUDS
The interview subjects in CLOUDS include Bruce Sterling, Casey Reas, Daniel Shiffman, Diederick Huijbers, Elliot Woods, Golan Levin, Greg Borenstein, Jer Thorp, Jesse Louis-Rosenberg, Jessica Rosenkrantz, Joel Gethin Lewis, Josh Nimoy, Julia Kaganskiy, Julian Oliver, Karolina Sobecka, Karsten “Toxi” Schmidt, Kyle Chayka, Kyle McDonald, Lindsay Howard, Marcus Wendt, Marius Watz, Nick Fox-Gieg, Paola Antonelli, Philip Whitfield, Rachel Binx, Regine Debatty, Satoru Higa, Shantell Martin, Sofy Yuditskaya, Theodore Watson, Vera Glahn, and Zachary Lieberman.
 A documentary in a videogame environment
The CLOUDS experience is generated from a database of richly tagged interviews. For you, the viewer, the story begins with your curiosity. You input a question or search term as the starting point, setting the initial trajectory. Just as an everyday conversation will often flow through series of digressions, each subject you encounter offers branching paths to unexplored regions of the video collection. A unique narrative experience is generated just for you. You can sit back and watch the story conversation unfold, or let your interaction with the system guide you toward surprising outcomes.
Visualization of the CLOUDS network
The CLOUDS documentary comes in the form of an application for Mac or Windows, presenting a full-screen, immersive, interactive audio-visual experience.
Be the first to experience CLOUDS: own a collectible data capsule
CLOUDS Data capsule with laser etched 3D pointcloud

A collectible object containing the CLOUDS installer
Premiere screening at Eyebeam NYC
If you are in the NYC area, consider donating for a ticket to our launch at Eyebeam in Chelsea! There you’ll see the film presented as an installation, meet the filmmakers and catch a few CLOUDS participants in person.
Clouds: Beta
In May we premiered Clouds: Beta, a pilot version of the project in a short video screened at Eyebeam. Since then, we have continued production with the intention of building the documentary in an interactive environment..
A film about creative technologies, using an emerging medium
CLOUDS is created with the RGBDToolkit -- an open-source software library we have developed for 3D filmmaking with the Kinect. Using a Microsoft XBOX Kinect depth sensor paired with an HD video camera, our toolkit makes possible the computer-graphic/video hybrid you see above. By supporting CLOUDS, you also support the development of the RGBDToolkit -- helping to make it better for everyone. We welcome you to try it out!
RGBD Filmmaking DIY Toolkit
The toolkit package contains 3D printable mounts to securely fasten the cameras, and custom software for calibrating, recording data, and visualizing it as full color three dimensional forms. Check out the RGBD tumblr to see the spectacular projects by other filmmakers who have adopted this format.

Help support RGBDToolkit version 1.0
In addition to completing the film, we will be releasing version 1.0 of the RGBDToolkit application. This will include several new features requested by the community including support across Mac, Windows and Linux, integration with Maya and Cinema 4D, easier and more accurate camera calibration, and new effects!
If you’re interested in making your own movies using this technique, check out the "Filmmaker" reward or host your own depth filmmaking workshop.
Depth filmmaking workshop at Hangar in Barcelona
How will you use the Kickstarter funds?
We need to expand our team to realize the complete interactive version of CLOUDS. Combining the workflows of documentary filmmaking and videogame production in a new format will involve coding, art direction, sound, editing, and interaction design. The majority of the funds will go to supplementing our two-person collaborative to a small team of co-creators.
We are working closely with several of the coders featured in the film to create new generative works embedded in the world of CLOUDS, allowing these artists to co-exist with their own creations in a computationally generated space! The Kickstarter’s success will ensure that we can compensate the artists as we collaborate to incorporate their work into the film.
Supporting Partners
It takes a community to make a film of this nature. To reach this stage in production, we have benefited from the help of friends and colleagues, including several key media arts organizations. In particular, we'd like to thank The Frank-Ratchye STUDIO for Creative Inquiry, Eyebeam Center for Art and Technology, YCAM InterLab, and NYU's ITP program for supporting us as we pursue the dream of an interactive documentary.
Special thanks to the Resonate and Eyeo festivals for inviting our crew to record interviews with their amazing presenters, and to capture the energy of these events in the film.
Your contribution to this project will ensure that the voices of these artists will be heard in a way never before possible.
Yours,
James and Jonathan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Adopting a real time paradigm

The RGBD data is computationally intense to visualize. We've already achieved smooth frame rates using this format for real-time installations, such as “Spectacle of Change,” (http://jamesgeorge.org/works/spectacle.html) so we know it can work. But creating the full interactive experience required by CLOUDS, that can run on a modern laptop and includes visual design, generative storytelling, and user interaction will require advancement in our techniques. We’ve already begun experiments that move the computation to shaders on the GPU, and are excited to overcome these challenges using data pre-processing, optimization, and design.

Extracting compelling narratives

As this is a documentary, the story is crucial. An essential component of our process involves designing algorithms to explore a database of ideas and conversations. Taking a generative approach to storytelling runs the risk of producing sequences that feel disjointed or repetitive. Applying knowledge from natural language processing and recommendation software in conjunction with exhaustive tagging of our content, we can craft a system to customize the experience based on your current interests, leading you to encounter content that personally resonates. All this will result in a Story Engine which offers audiences many access points to this world of art and code.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We’re thrilled to announce the official launch of CLOUDS!
A full version of the documentary is now available now for purchase or rental on our new website at http://www.cloudsdocumentary.com.
This release is a first, and a major milestone, for interactive documentary and virtual reality film distribution. Through a platform provided by VHX, anyone with an internet connection will be able to experience CLOUDS from home on OS X or Windows, compatible with the Oculus Rift DK2.

Dear CLOUDS Backers,  
We have some some exciting updates to share with you!  
Yebisu International Festival for Art & Alternative Visions
Next week we will be traveling to Tokyo, Japan to exhibit CLOUDS at the Yebisu International Festival for Arts and Alternative Visions. The festival has graciously translated a large portion of CLOUDS into Japanese! We'll be showing both the Oculus DK2 version alongside the gallery installation, as well as Jonathan and James presenting a guided tour for a live audience.

Dear CLOUDS Backers,
A quick update to let you know that the CLOUDS directors' tour will be featured at the XOXO festival in Portland, Oregon. If you are attending, don't miss us tomorrow night at 8:00PM.
http://2014.xoxofest.com/film-animation/
While the CLOUDS installation travels to festivals, we are continuing to work through the technical challenges of creating the downloadable version. It's been an immense challenge beyond creating the initial installation and we thank you for your continued support and patience. We'll have more updates for you soon!

campaign.story:
Hello!
Thanks for checking out our project. With your help, we hope to get Olly and Molly out in the world!
Who is Molly?
Molly is the latest addition to the Ollyfactory family.
She is a module that turns your tweets into sweets by counting how many times you get retweeted, then  releasing a tasty candy when a number you've set is reached.
You can stack Molly and Olly together to release sweets and smells.
You can set Molly to count a number of re-tweets with our simple app.
Who is Olly?
Olly is a web-connected smelly robot that turns your online notifications into smells.
You can fill Olly with any smell you like, such as your partner’s perfume or an essential oil.
He's also stackable, meaning you can have different smells for different notifications.
What is the app?
We’re also making an app for your computer, so it’s really easy to connect Olly and Molly to your Twitter account.
You can set Olly to notify you of an @mention, if you get re-tweeted or for a search you've set.
Molly can also count your re-tweets and release a candy when that number is reached.
About:
This project is the offspring of a research team called Foundry, based at Mint Digital in London, looking to  “Make something connected to the Internet that doesn’t live on a screen”
We became interested in smells because they’re crucial to generating memories and emotions. They’re also good at notifying you of important things, like whether you might like the taste of something or if you left the gas on.
We wanted to see how this could affect our online experiences, especially on social platforms such as Twitter. That was the spark that led to the creation of Olly.
Olly is a modular platform, so he can be added to very easily with new modules. The first of these new Modules is Molly. We would like to be able to build many new modules for the Olly platform in the future. We're keen to explore human factors such as smell
Where does your pledge go?
We need a few things to get Olly and Molly out into the world:
1: Tooling the molds to make Olly’s outer case.
2: Further developing our app to include platforms like Facebook, Instagram and email.
3: Creating additional modules for Olly (like Molly).
So...
We think it’s awesome that small companies like us can have a go at making physical things that big companies might be a bit scared to do.
We'd really like to turn ollyfactory.com into a platform for creating and distributing web connected objects. It’s you guys that can make this possible, and contribute to what you think we should make next.
We're also excited about exploring the potential of locally producing all of the products we make. There are some really interesting things happening with small scale manufacture at the moment and we want to explore this avenue.
We can't wait to get Olly and Molly out there and will keep you updated every step of the way.
Thanks very much for checking out our project and have an awesome day.
Note: The code and digital files for Olly are all licensed under a Creative Commons license so if anyone wants to mess about with an Olly for themselves, or develop some new apps, they will be able to do so. We are excited about creating an Olly API in the future.

updates.update_content: Hello everyone.Now I'm no pessimist but with one hour to go it looks like we might not reach our goal. I'd like to thank everyone for their support, pledges,  and for spreading the good word of Olly. It's been awesome and exciting and an absolute pleasure to work with everyone who got involved. On another note, $11,000 in thirty five days is not half bad. You guys rock.However, it's not all doom and gloom… Ollyfactory is far from over. In fact, its only really just begun. The amount of interest this Kickstarter campaign created has lead us to pursue many different avenues for Olly and Molly. For this reason, we will be continuing with the production of Olly and Molly and maybe even some new members of the family. We're not entirely sure what shape this may take yet, but we'll keep you all informed over at . Whatever happens, we want you guys to be involved.Thanks again for all your help, love and support.

Hello everyone,
A few people have been asking for a bit of clarity on what each pledge consists of. I hope this helps...
  $50 - Olly.

Yo everyone,
Just thought you might like to see how simple it's going to be to connect your Olly or Molly to a twitter account.
It's not very shiny yet but look how easy this little chap is looking:
Hello everyone. I'd like to introduce you to Molly, the newest addition to the Olly family. She turns your retweets into sweets!

Hello everyone! We've been hard at work at the Ollyfactoy making Olly even more amazing… Thank you so much for all your support so far, it's been awesome! We're nearly at the $6000 mark which is super cool!
And it's all down to you - So thanks a bunch. But we still have work to do!  Twenty days left and $29,000 to go is no easy task, but it can be done, and it will be epic! It's time to take to the streets, activate the Twittersphere and start making some LOUD NOISES. God speed my lovely pledging pals.
